numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A legacy applicant is an applicant whose parent attended the college.
2. It is more likely that a legacy applicant is accepted to a top college than that a non-legacy applicant is accepted to a top college.
3. Some students have access to top tutors.
4. Some students have access to admissions counselors.
5. Access to top tutors is a confounding variable for college acceptance.
6. Access to admissions counselors is a confounding variable for college acceptance.
7. A confounding variable can affect the likelihood that a student is accepted to a top college.
10. Some peers of my parents attended some schools.
11. The schools that my parents attended impact my ability to go to certain colleges.
12. The schools that the peers of my parents attended impact my ability to go to certain colleges.
13. Some admissions scandals involve legacy applicants.
15. If a college prioritizes legacy applicants then the college may limit future generations.
